meanings.definition: A person of low social status or moral character.
meanings.sent1: The town gossip always called him a lowlife behind his back.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the criminal was a lowlife from the moment he saw him.
meanings.sent3: The lowlife tried to cheat at cards but ended up losing all his money.
meanings.sent4: The politician referred to his opponent as a lowlife in the heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a lowlife who would stop at nothing to get what he wanted.

meanings.sent1: The bully was known as the school's biggest lowlife.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist was considered a lowlife by everyone who knew him.
meanings.sent3: The lowlife thought he could get away with lying, but he was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The criminal's actions were so lowlife that even his own gang members turned against him.
meanings.sent5: The novel's antagonist was a true lowlife, causing trouble wherever he went.
